newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PX50 closes down led by major issues.
newsitem.headline: Czech PX50 closes down led by major issues.

text.p: The Czech PX50 took another battering on Monday with three of the five most heavily capitalised shares posting heavy losses which pushed the index down 1.1 percent to 478.7.
The biggest loser was IPB Bank which lost 21 crowns, or 7.3 percent of its value to close at 266.

Analysts said that IPB's fall was due to local newspaper reports that an investment fund was claiming 1.25 billion crowns from the bank in connection with a dispute over the sale of shares in Kreditni Banka and Agrobanka at the beginning of 1996.
"It is just because of these reports," said Pavel Sobisek of Zivnostneska Banka.
Other major issues also fell sharply. SPT Telecom lost 70 crowns, 2.4 percent, to 2,900, and CEZ dropped 43 crowns, 4.5 percent, to 905.
Komercni Banka rose nine crowns to 1,810 but lost most of its early gains and Ceska Sporitelna closed up 12 crowns to 282.
